title: How wage hikes can lead to more customer happiness
text:
Minimum wage: A political lie that hurts poor and unskilled workers 
If shelves aren’t stocked, lines are long and employees are too tired, overworked and under-rewarded to smile, that can derail great customer service, even though you have low prices. What if some customers are happy with great deals but some customers are unhappy because they’re treated poorly? Seeing the connections 
More and more employers are realizing a contented, economically secure workforce contributes to the bottom line. 
Walmart is grasping this concept. In a statement from earlier this year, the retailer’s CEO Doug McMillon said, “We’re strengthening investments in our people to engage and inspire them to deliver superior customer experiences.” 
Clearly, the most successful organizations see the connections. It may be the hot new business strategy, as Fast Company declared in a recent article about the pay-raising trend. Page
